title: Magnetic materials - metallic bars near bar magnet

content.question: Let <math alttext="B sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="B sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="B sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> be the magnitudes of the magnetic field strengths measured in trials <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>, respectively. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="B sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="B sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="B sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="B sub 1 is less than B sub 2, which is less than B sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="B sub 1 is less than B sub 3, which is less than B sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="B sub 3 is less than B sub 1, which is less than B sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="B sub 1 equals B sub 3, which is less than B sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="B sub 1 is less than B sub 3, which is less than B sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
